title: im tired and sick of zed
body:
every damn game theres a damn zed that at lvl 6 just makes you a combo and no matter if you buy damn armor instead of your usual items, he kills you, they dont buy boots they dont buy potions even at a sliver of health they still 100/0  tower diving

they should get rid of lethalithy or get rid of ad as part of auto attacks, cuz this is just bs the amount of damage zed gets early game

"get rid of  ad as part of auto attacks"

GL LOL
REMOVE AUTO ATTACKS RIOT!

It's not as bad. I really don't get why people have so much trouble LANING vs Zed. I understand being frustrated when you are an ADC and your mid laner allows him free laning and roaming, but as a mid laner, he's really not that strong.

Viktor destroys Zed and Viktor is a 47% win rate champion. Orianna is good against him as well.

If you have trouble, try using Exhaust or Barrier. These summoners will almost 100% guarantee you won't die during his first R, and your flash will guarantee you won't die to his second one either. When his third R is back up, you will have Exh or Barrier again. 

Also, the buff  to Seeker's Armguard is substantial enough. Now, you can go back, but your Lost chapter and a Cloth Armour, which you can then turn into Seeker's and basically never die again.

I just watched your op.gg and let me gues, you're complaining about that NORMAL game you played Ryze and went 0/4/0 vs a Zed you got Black Cleaver first? You know you have a problem laning against Zed and you still went on to take Ignite instead of Barrier or Exhaust. Your runes were also atrocious, all of them. Aery does nothing for Ryze, Ultimate Hat and Transcendence are useless on Ryze. You had a huge disadvantage on runes and summoners, so there's one reason. 
Another reason is that you suck at the game as well. You are in silver 5, which is low elo and you only managed 3.9 cs / min as Ryze, vs a Zed who had no boots and got Black Cleaver first item. 

How about trying to learn how to play the game first, and then complain about certain picks, because the way I see it, you are bitching about Zed because you are genuinely bad at the game.

By the way, a good tip: Don't play mid lane right now, and even more so, don't play Ryze.

According to your own source op.gg, {{champion:238}}  winrate is 54% vs {{champion:61}}  and {{champion:112}}. He has 52% winrate overall and 10% playrate. For a so-called "high skill" champ he sure seems easy to pull off.. He consistently has high winrates vs almost all mages and champs that take longer time to output their damage than him.

The only champs that win against him in lane is {{champion:105}} and {{champion:245}} assassins with untargetable and {{champion:8}} {{champion:127}} {{champion:10}} {{champion:26}} mages with untargetable/unkillable abilities. Also {{champion:50}} (insanely tanky with ulti). 

**He is literally shitting on all other picks aka. Normal mages. **

http://euw.op.gg/champion/zed/statistics/mid

He has a high skill ceiling, but he isn't hard to do pretty well with, especially in low elo. I can carry in lower elo as Zed easily and I've only played Zed like 2 times in my life. He isn't hard to do well with, that's why people play him and he has a good win rate.

But again, the reason he's winning is because he can roam and pick up easy kills and snowball the game from there. And that's a problem stemming from you, the mid laner. You ALLOW him to roam as much or, even worse, you let him solo kill you. In almost all low elo, people just fear Zed, they think he is just magically going to kill them, which makes them play extremely passive and let him have a free laning phase and lose out on xp and gold.

I can't recall the last time I lost a lane vs Zed as Viktor. I always out cs him, out level him and probably even kill him. It's really not that hard, as long as you get out of the bubble that Zed is OP or something. Keep up the pressure, shove him under tower, be careful to avoid poke and deny him a free laning phase and roaming.

It doesnt really matter how YOU play as an individual, its easy to preach your crappy generalist advice for midlane and look down on more than half the playerbase. But just look at the statistics, they speak for themselves. 

Players in general **(we are speaking plat + in korea, according to op.gg)** are struggling vs him. Yes i agree he is not hard to play, as he used to be. Riot removed his skill expression and inflated his winrate with pure dmg instead. Why do you think people play passive vs him? maybe because he "pokes" 70% hp from a basic combo with {{item:3134}} alone? A basic RANGED combo on a fucking MELEE assassin.

His difficulty rating is 3, same as Cassio, Azir and Asol, champs that are far harder and stressful to pull off correctly, and only when you have aquired the skill through countless games and practice, can you carry the game and win.

According to your exact source, the best 'counter champions' are Sol, Malphite, and Swain. I'll give you props for getting Swain right, but neither Sol or Malphite have untargetables. In fact, Sol is pretty immobile.
Sol is all about perma shoving and roaming to other lanes, he never needs to 1v1 the zed. Malphite is pretty obvious since he stacks armor and gets armor from his kit.
It's almost like you don't wanna 1v1 an assassin without proper burst/defense.

Explain how I don't concede mid priority as an immobile mage like lux while keeping myself alive against zed. If I don't let him push, I risk giving him longer to all in on me, in which I doubt just flash or exhaust will save me. Shoving them in and "forcing them to use abilities on minions" doesn't work, they'll just kill you first then farm the wave with autos.

Instead, by conceding mid priority I never die, but my bot lane also never listens to my pings and always dies. So I'm stuck in this ultimatum where I have to either put myself at super high risk or put my bot lane at risk, and it's not fun to play against that crap. That's actually most of the reason I stopped playing mid recently, as the top meta picks all force you to do the same thing.

If you get killed by Zed at level 6, then that's your fault. If you're low then you shouldn't be in lane anyways, and you never should be low because if he uses his combo, it's very easy to dodge and makes trading with him easier.
Please, constructive advice will only get you downvotes...

What is so constructive about telling others to dodge his skillshots? O WOW, i didn't know that skillshots could be dodged!

The biggest issue with Zed like people are clearly mentioning is that whilst he goes longsword and 3 fkn pots, you as a mage who rely on mana go dorans and then seekers guard. Not only are you delaying your damage but you will also most likely have mana issues so that if you wanted to poke him (which you have an advantage over) , you will go oom, whilst zed just waits and spams his Q to farm. So automatically one way of punishing a meele champ (range) has been taken away from us. The second way of having a choice over your build is taken away as no matter the circumstances you would have to go zhonyas first item. On the other hand ZED just builds into his usual lethality items. If you were to say to buy seekers guard because ZED got ahead of you then it would make sense and as most Zed's tend to go defensive if they lose early on.

So the counterplay to zed is to buy zhonyas and zhonyas his ult but guess fkn what? He will W,E,Q + elec to take you down to half health or so and then wait a bit and ult. WOW i must go back to base because it took ZED one rotation of spells that he facerolled and took me to half health without even being in danger himself because of his fkn shadow. Now the second advantage of having burst as a mage is taken away because he can poke you from a distance and if he manages to take you down low enough he'll swap with his shadow and AA you to death. So basically Zed dictates when he wants to end your life.

If all of this wasn't enough, one other counterplay to zed is to push the wave but guess what? Mages are immobile and are usually vulnerable to ganks but if God forbid if a Zed was to push he'll escape like he was never there or just ult and take a kill and juke the jgler. 

Please construct me more counterplay to Zed? Or are you thinking of counterpicking {{champion:105}} this guy into him? Because he clearly belongs in the same category as him (Cancer assassin) but its the mages that are actually suffering. Lastly its not fkn about AD or AP. This thread is on ZED so we'll speak and talk ZED. I hate Leb for the same reasons._

Edit: Oh FK ME i forgot about ignite. Need i go on more? 
Edit: Also please don't fkn tell me to all in him if he uses his W or call your jgler because he is vulnerable. You think a Jgler would be sitting in wait for Zed to use his W, especially after the new jgl changes? Furthermore, most mages rely on skillshots to cc so how the fk am i suppose to cc him when he is behind minnions, W's to me and E,Q's? Mages do use AA to farm  you know and don't just spam abilities all the tim. so we are now and then within his W's range.
Some have even mentioned to farm whilst his abilities are on CD, just please throw these fkn suggestions out of the window. When he has poked you and then you use those abilities to farm, he'll then use that opportunity to All-in you whilst your abilities on CD. The moral of story is that there is no counterplay to a ZED who  has a brain in his head.

First of all, your problem is that you take all of that way to personal. Being that emotional will cause you to play worse against certain champions, that is a psychological effect.
Additionally the AP Assassins that you mentioned have the weakness that they are either melee or have high mana costs/low or offensive waveclear. Let's not talk about them, because they definitely clearly have better counterplay.
As the other guy said, Zed's greatest weakness is being a melee. Yes, as a trade-off he has high damage during the whole game, peaking in the mid-game, and yes, he is delaying any mages powerspike. But why rush on duels then? I feel like you are doing exactly that and then you are surprised that you die. If he wants to poke you long-range, he has a 20 seconds timer on that, and it is REALLY easy to dodge. He won't all-in you then unless you push your lane hard. Even a Zed can't towerdive you without dying when you are close to your tower and controlling the waves.
You need to pick the right champion of course. One with hard cc, sustain and strong wave control to get him out of the lane.
If you play it right you should be able to farm from far out of his q range and deny, you shouldn't allow him to engage you past 6 by staying back and of course you need to care when he disappears to roam. 

One last thing - anyone who is perfect on a decent champion will reduce its counterplay to a minimum. Champions with blinks can just outplay you easier.

Forget about me being emotional because my frustration is with Zed main's that defend that broken champ with justifications like " you are ranged and he is melee".

Therefore i disagree with your statement that "Zed's greatest weakness is being a melee". He never has to rely on AA tbh as much as other melee do and he has decent ranged aoe clear.

I never said i rush a duel with him. On the contrary i would love ways not to rush ways to duel with him because i will scale better than him if Zed doesn't snowball. Funnily, one other thing that frustrates me is how contradictory the justification regarding Zed can be. You are telling me not to rush a duel, but another guy said to me "People are too scared to play aggressive on Zed since lvl 1 and “play safe” only to let him free farm" and you said "But why rush on duels then? I feel like you are doing exactly that and then you are surprised that you die". 

Lastly, you probably don't have an idea of Zed's powerspike after he gets{{item:3134}} that costs him only 1,100g and of which he has already spent 350 at the beginning of the game. Ignite just makes this worse with all the damage runes such as sudden impact.

Lastly, how is his W, spam E'Q combo easy to dodge, when he has W'd right into your face? Maybe throw a spell back at him but that'll be it. Unless that spell is cc, you won't be doing much back to him whilst he'll proc elec and be able to use lethality from sudden impact.

He is an assassin so yes he should be allowed to burst but what I want to know is the counterplay to a good zed. No mana, ranged ult, ranged aoe waveclear, 4 blinks and easy and cost effective build. He has all the outplay mechanics he requires. Why is it that as a brand main i get fed 10 kills in lane at times but i am still unable to snowball as hard as Zed can? Because there are obvious counters to Brand which you can get around if you play smart but not vice versa for Zed.

I think that, in case we are talking about a matchup against a really experienced Zed Main, there is no point in playing offensively because he will know how to CS. There are enough situations where he has to go melee for last-hits, because either he pokes you or he is tring to one-shot the wave. There is no way he can do both unless you are in the middle of the wave. Those spells ARE dodgeable, and if you are that close, then you were out of position.
His powerspikes are strong, but Lethality is not that high on early levels, even with the mastery you mentioned. If your timing is right, you can get your Seeker's when he gets his first Lethality.
About the counter-picking, of course your matchup can be considered lost if you have the wrong champion against him. Pretty unfair right? Totally agree on that, but that happens so often in this game with any champion.
As you can see, there is counterplay. I don't want to deny that his strength at the moment is too high and will become higher, especially after Last Whisper is reverted. But hey, then there won't be much counterplay anyway. So he should be banned...

Yh consider an experienced mage player v an experienced zed. What i am trying to get across is that the experience of the mage player is more or less moot as long as Zed is experienced because he outplays you and you can only outplay him when he has allowed you to i.e made mistakes.

Every spell that is a skill-shot is dodgeable so that's a fact  but that does mean i am out of position to get poked by him. As i mentioned before that mages either have to poke or farm with abilities. Thus seekers guard makes it even more difficult to punish zed as you'll have to use your mana sparingly in laning phase before you can get chapter to either poke him or farm. However, mages do not just farm with abilities, they also use AA. They are even more so likely to rely on aa to farm against zed for above reasons. He'll simply use the same technique you are advising me to use i.e. poke me when i go to AA hence i have to sacrifice between farm and worry about his poke. Once he has poked me obviously he won't be able to farm and will back out until i use my abilities to farm. However, after his first small item {{item:3134}} you can expect him to poke you once and then ult and burst you and that is when you have seekers, without that he can burst you without even poking with ignite.

Then once he gets a kill, you know what happens? He snowballs hard af and roams all lanes especially bot.

As for counter picking then if you were to lose to Zed even after counter picking then you have yourself to blame but i completely agree that without counterpicking against Zed, it is ever so difficult to stop Zed snowballing. If he had a tons of counter pick options then it would be understandable but considering his playrate, mid laners are forced to main counters to him and if he picks before you in selection then always pick a safe pick that can counter Zed. If he doesn't need damage nerf then he needs a nerf which enables more counter play to him.

Then play Zed? Seriously. Every time I see someone complain about a champion, they completely ignore their weaknesses. The best way to learn a champions weaknesses is just play them. 

Zed is a MELEE CHAMPION. Force him to use Q to CS. Without his Q he is worthless. Every time he uses Q it’s a free invitation to do whatever the fuck you want in lane cause he has no pressure. 

People are too scared to play aggressive on Zed since lvl 1 and “play safe” only to let him free farm, poke for free, and push/roam for free and don’t even try to abuse him “because he’s Zed” and passively lose the game instead of even fucking trying to learn how to abuse him in his weak points.

I don't know whats happening in pro play currently, but the game is not meant to be balanced around them because a Zed is unlikely to snowball there with 2 mandatory tanks that always keep their squshies alive and players there are not brain dead.
